body: I'm partial to the NASB but I also like NIV ESV and NKJV depending on which wording sounds better (more natural) to me
body_html: I'm partial to the NASB but I also like NIV ESV and NKJV depending on which wording sounds better (more natural) to me

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

title: Which Bible do you use?

author.bio: Just an old fart looking for a community without having propaganda thrust upon me. I'll choose the drama I want to participate in, don't need any extra
author.bio_html: Just an old fart looking for a community without having propaganda thrust upon me. I'll choose the drama I want to participate in, don't need any extra

body: NIV, but I read a lot of translations to get a good understanding. Septuagint with Apocrypha, the Dead sea scrolls and Josephus complete works are also in my library. LDS doctrine and covenants as well as JW and Catholic books. Immerse yourself in it and will be amazing the understanding you will obtain. Joseph Campbell and his writings on mythology will expand your mind as well. I'm older, didn't read all this stuff in a few years, it takes time
body_html: NIV, but I read a lot of translations to get a good understanding. Septuagint with Apocrypha, the Dead sea scrolls and Josephus complete works are also in my library. LDS doctrine and covenants as well as JW and Catholic books. Immerse yourself in it and will be amazing the understanding you will obtain. Joseph Campbell and his writings on mythology will expand your mind as well. I'm older, didn't read all this stuff in a few years, it takes time

body: NASB is the best contemporary Bible for literal understanding. I use the NRSV with Oxford Commentary because it's an ideal research Bible. Great for understanding historical context, plus it translates the entire Greek Old Testament, not just the Protestant/Jewish or Catholic canon.
body_html: NASB is the best contemporary Bible for literal understanding. I use the NRSV with Oxford Commentary because it's an ideal research Bible. Great for understanding historical context, plus it translates the entire Greek Old Testament, not just the Protestant/Jewish or Catholic canon.
